tool.name: Filters samples from an OTU table
tool.description: on the basis of the number of observations in that sample, or on the basis of sample metadata
tool.command:
filter_samples_from_otu_table.py --input_fp '$input_fp' --output_fp '$output_fp'
#if $filtering.type == "abundance" --min_count '$filtering.min_count' #if str($filtering.max_count) != '' --max_count '$filtering.max_count' #end if #else if $filtering.type == "metadata" --mapping_fp '$filtering.mapping_fp' --valid_states '$filtering.valid_states' #if $filtering.output_mapping == "true" --output_mapping_fp '$output_mapping_fp' #end if #else if $filtering.type == "id" --sample_id_fp '$filtering.sample_id_fp' $filtering.negate_sample_id_fp #end if

param.label: Minimum total observation count in a sample for that sample to be retained
Maximum total observation count in a sample for that sample to be retained
File listing sample ids to keep
param.help: Valid formats for the file are: 1) any white space, newline, or tab delimited list of samples, 2) a mapping file with samples in the first column

param.label: Discard samples specified instead of keeping them?

tool.help:
**What it does**
Filters samples from an OTU table on the basis of the number of observations in that sample, or on the basis of sample metadata. Mapping file can also be filtered to the resulting set of sample ids
